Articles.Content: Americans, just wanted to tell you I love America, and you should even more than me.

I must say, I am unimpressed by NASA TV's broadcast... too much emphasis on the 'social impact' of this opposed to the actual science and happenings.

I have to agree with you there, it feels like a sports pregame show.
Hypehypehype

Hoorah!

Now it's just time to wait for some good hard data...

...and is is a bad thing that I got up about an hour earlier than usual just to watch this thing?

-Upsilon

Congradulations to NASA for making the flyby! Great work everyone, you made history!

and yes I have no life because I got up 4 hours earlier to watch this

also ninja'd by bagel rabbit.
ok, so now we can all sit back and wait equally tensed for the return signal and images to be transmitted in oh... anything between 9 and 16 hours

AFAIK, you didn't miss much, the real excitement is when we get the transmission, I doubt they will hype that as much as they hyped closest approach.

Congrats to the NH team!
This weekend I'm building the probe. only time

I hope not, I got up two hours earlier.

maybe i can fall back asleep:D
Where can I watch this going on? All the streams and sites I know are (for obvious reasons) very slow.

Those of you who downloaded the app and watched the simulation of the flyby, likely better spent your time than those of us scanning the news for word (which no major networks that I breezed through made any mention of) or watching NASA's tv.

Isn't all this hype a bit of a case of counting the chickens before they hatch? I mean, it would be so anticlimactic if they celebrated and made all that hype only for it to turn out that (god forbid) the probe failed, like a hour before closest approach or something like that.
